definition: to reason/to argue logically
to persuade
to speak/to say/to explain/to scold/to tell off/a theory (typically the last character in a compound, as in 日心說|日心说 heliocentric theory)
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: Persuasive writing is about changing somebody else's point of view.
sentences.chinese: 說理性文章是關於改變別人觀點的文章。

sentences.english: The persuasive process can be rewardingly studied as such.
sentences.chinese: 真正的說理過程可以被有價值地學習。

sentences.english: Lunyu was not the lowest form of argumentations in pre-qin dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 《論語》並非先秦說理文的低級形式。

sentences.english: Changing a person's beliefs by argument or reasoning or entreaty .
sentences.chinese: 通過爭論或說理懇求改變一個人的信仰。

sentences.english: We must learn to conquer mistaken ideas through debate and reasoning.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須學會通過辯論和說理來戰勝錯誤思想。

sentences.english: And if all attempts to reason fail, do not despair.
sentences.chinese: 如果所有試圖說理都失敗了，不要絕望。

sentences.english: If you temper criticism with reason, everyone can obey you.
sentences.chinese: 如果以說理來緩和批評，誰都會服從你。

sentences.english: Let's go and reason things out with him.
It's wise to settle the dispute through reason.
sentences.chinese: 明智的方法是，通過說理去解決爭端。
批評應該是充分說理的。

definition: to argue/to reason with sb/to talk sense/to be reasonable
to guide patiently and systematically (idiom)
harmful teachings/evil doctrine
to dispute/to refute
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
to make far-fetched claims (idiom)/to offer outlandish explanations
plain/clear/obvious
to sound out the difficulties and retreat to avoid defeat (idiom); fig. to back out of an awkward situation/to get out on finding out what it's really like
arbitrary/subjective/dogmatic
to speak forcefully and with justice (idiom); to argue with the courage of one's convictions
to make an irrelevant comparison or interpretation (idiom)
to make insinuations/to take an indirect approach (in making inquiries) (idiom)
to make a story or theory consistent/to give a plausible explanation/to plug the holes in one's story
eloquent/oratory/rhetoric
to fool the world and usurp a good name (idiom)
